channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Topological lax comma categories
item.description: arXiv:2504.12965v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper investigates the interplay between properties of a topological space $X$, in particular of its natural order, and properties of the lax comma category $\mathsf{Top} \Downarrow X$, where $\mathsf{Top}$ denotes the category of topologicalspaces and continuous maps. Namely, it is shown that, whenever $X$ is a topological $\bigwedge$-semilattice, the canonical forgetful functor $\mathsf{Top} \Downarrow X \to \mathsf{Top}$ is topological, preserves and reflects exponentials, and preserves effective descent morphisms. Moreover, under additional conditions on $X$, a characterisation of effective descent morphisms is obtained.
item.dc:creator: Maria Manuel Clementino, Dirk Hofmann, Rui Prezado

item.title: Wandering Flows on the Plane
item.description: arXiv:2504.11751v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We study planar flows without non-wandering points and prove several properties of these flows in relation with their prolongational relation. The main results of this article are that a planar (regular) wandering flow has no generalized recurrence and has only two topological invariants: the space of its orbits and its prolongational relation (or, equivalently, its smallest stream). As a byproduct, our results show that, even in absence of any type of recurrence, the stream of a flow contains fundamental information on its behavior.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Auslander, Roberto De Leo
